fields.headline: Jo set for City debut
fields.bodyText: The Brazilian striker Jo is expected to make his debut tonight in Mark Hughes' first game in charge of Manchester City, the first leg of their Uefa Cup first qualifying round tie against the Faroe part-timers EB/Streymur. Hughes is leaving nothing to chance and has travelled with his strongest possible squad. Jo, signed from CSKA Moscow for £19m, will lead the attack and there is a place in the squad for the striker Rolando Bianchi. Micah Richards is also likely to play after returning from injury. Richard Dunne, fresh from signing a new contract, will captain the side. Provisional squad: Hart, Schmeichel, Onuoha, Dunne, Richards, Ball, Corluka, Garrido, Petrov, Hamann, Johnson, Ireland, Jo, Elano, Vassell, Benjani, Evans, Bianchi.
